intro: Pimelea spiculigera, commonly known as the narrowleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value. Pimelea spiculigera is also known for its ability to attract native pollinators such as bees and birds.
